alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:49AM CDT until April 11 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN COLES...SOUTHWESTERN EDGAR...WESTERN CLARK AND CUMBERLAND COUNTIES... At 949 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Janesville, or 8 miles northeast of Toledo, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Casey, Westfield, Martinsville and Clarksville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 181 and 188. Interstate 70 between mile markers 105 and 139. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
